snippet.title: Mid Slow Funk Jam All Instruments Backing Track | Eb Major BPM90
snippet.description:
ğŸ’“Notes on playing solosğŸ’“
Here are a few pointers for playing ad-libs in this chord progression.
This chord progression does not require a different scale for each chord progression; you can play improvisation with one scale. Let's use both a dark-sounding type of scale and a light-sounding type of scale to express this. Then check how they sound with the chord. Once you are comfortable with it, practice playing it with fewer notes, then play it melodically.
Watch this video over and over again and practice hard so you can enjoy improvising!

â—¾ï¸Bb Mixolydian Scale
Bb C D Eb F G Ab Bb

â—¾ï¸C Minor Pentatonic Scale
C Eb F G Bb C

Choose your favorite backing track and use it for solo practice, chord backing, and bassline practice.It's a lot of fun when you can copy and play your favorite tracks!
All the tracks are composed, played, recorded and mixed by us.You will also learn how to mix and mastering tracks!And if you like it, please subscribe to the channel.
Let's get started !!


ã€ Mid Slow Funk Funk Jam Eb Major BPM90 BackingTrack ã€‘

All Instruments version ã€For Vocal, Guitar, Bass, Drum, Piano, Saxã€‘
â–·https://youtu.be/fUo5GKPjmco

No Guitar versionã€For Guitarã€‘
â–·https://youtu.be/SmntCRzWZwI

No Bass versionã€For Bassã€‘
â–·https://youtu.be/Y7oFUkUH9ig

No Piano versionã€For Pianoã€‘
â–·https://youtu.be/6KgR_vI65Jc

No Drums versionã€For Drumsã€‘
â–·https://youtu.be/Dd0QqGyRtfM


ã€How to practiceã€‘
Listen to the full version first to see the chord movements and bassline phrases of your instrument, then practice with the minus one-track sound source for each instrument.When you have a cool pattern, please upload it to YouTube.We always check the video. And I will introduce it in the user area of â€‹â€‹the playlist.And please comment more and more if you have any questions or concerns !!
We will answer more and more questions ğŸ˜ƒ

We hope you like our music and videos.
Please click like or subscribe to â€œMusic Jam Tracks Channelâ€ for more awesome contents.
â†’http://www.youtube.com/c/MusicJamTracks

ã€Tips for improvingã€‘
Practice playing one track as long as possible.By repeating the phrases you create, you will be able to concentrate more during the performance and be able to judge your performance objectively.
The same is true for solo practice, and by playing for a long time, you can judge your phrase calmly and objectively, and the problems become clear.

ã€To the owner of Music University, Music College, Music Class, Personal Music Classã€‘
If you would like to use Music Jam Tracks backing tracks as part of a curriculum like lessons or lessons, please contact us at the address below.We will cooperate in curriculum consulting and comprehensive production.

musicjamtrack@gmail.com

ã€Usage notesã€‘
ãƒ»Music Jam Tracks backing tracks are only available on Youtube.
ãƒ»Be sure to include a clear link to the backing track you used with Music Jam Tracks when uploading videos that you played along to our songs to Youtube.
ãƒ»We will share the videos that you played in the user area of â€‹â€‹the Music Jam Tracks channel, so it would be nice if you could comment on the backing track videos.
ãƒ»Music Jam Tracks owns the copyright of all music and videos in this channel.
ãƒ»It is prohibited to do secondary use such as reproduction, diversion, alteration, image capture, sale without permission.

ğŸ’–Download the backing track    
â–· https://musicjamtracks.bandcamp.com/music

ğŸ’™Music jam Tracks web site      
â–· https://www.music-jam-tracks.com/

#MidSlowFunk #MusicJamTracks #Backingtrack #Bass
